humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that there are metastases present in two of the thirteen lymph nodes (2/13). According to the AJCC staging system, this corresponds to an N1 stage. Specifically, it is an N1a stage since the largest metastatic focus measures 4mm in greatest microscopic dimension and there is no extranodal extension. Therefore, the N stage from this report is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for this patient is N1 because metastatic carcinoma is present in 2 out of the 13 examined lymph nodes (pN1a). This is stated in the report: 'Regional Nodes [pN]: pN1a: Metastasis in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes (at least 1 tumor deposit greater than 2.0mm). Number involved: 2. Number examined: 13.' The report also mentions 'No extranodal extension is identified,' which is consistent with pN1a.
